channel.title: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?
channel.description:
I was just curious on how earphones work. My earphones the cables started coming out and I found something really cool. If I disconnected one of the cables, I could hear the audio only and when if I removed the other one I could hear the background music only. The 3rd cable most likely being a power cable?
Was that just a concidence? I just wanted to know how sound files actually handle playback. Is everything sent in layers? I was using Spotify, would the format matter?

item.title: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

Mopman:

Manipulated in what sense?

Just edit the output, send something else to the output, moving data between channels and whatever else.

Read full topic

item.title: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?
item.dc:creator: @my-swagger my-swagger
item.description:
@my-swagger wrote:

I see. So there’s no specific way that a format transmits data.

As for channels, can they be manipulated?

item.source: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?

item.title: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Well it’s most likely that these three cables represent the left channel, right channel and finally the signal ground. In the particular song you were listening to, I presume the “background” was panned to one channel and the “foreground” to the other which creates this effect.

The format of the digital music irrelevant - any sound, regardless of how it’s stored, will end up being converted to an uncompressed format like PCM which is sent to the Digital-Analogue-Converter (DAC) where the digital information is converted to an analogue signal which are needed to drive a pair of headphones.

Read full topic
item.source: How do headphones/earphones transmit audio / How sound files store the data?
